definition: (in literature and opera) a place to which a monarch banishes a wife or concubine who falls from favor/(fig.) the doghouse/a state of disfavor
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale
to snub/to consign to the trash heap of history

sentences.english: Substitute ego, also substitute the month imperial concubine who is silly to wait that person in the chilly temple.
sentences.chinese: 替自己，也替那个在冷宫里傻傻等着那一人的月妃。

sentences.english: This single-mindedness seems to leave little room for romance or procreation.
sentences.chinese: 这种执著似乎也把恋爱生子打入了冷宫。

sentences.english: The mini-skirt caught on quickly but disappeared equally fast.
sentences.chinese: 迷你裙迅即流行，但是很快就被打入冷宫。

definition: to snub/to consign to the trash heap of history
to imprison/to place under house arrest
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
Lateral Courts in the imperial palace (housing concubines and administrative offices
(old) (esp. of the Emperor) to show special favor towards
